column2: Video Production Specialist             Definition       :       Under general direction, plans and facilitates studio and field-based video production work, including the editing, sound mixing, graphic design and compression output and distribution of a wide range of products, and performs other related duties as assigned.          Directly Responsible to:         Appropriate Marketing Department Administrator            DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES            (This position may not include all of the listed duties, nor do all of the listed examples include all tasks which may be found in this classification.)          Studio Production          Works in collaboration with other marketing team members and staff to produce a variety of video products for compression output, webcasting, video streaming, and digital distribution; executes on assigned studio productions; operates video switching, character generation and digital video effects equipment, edit controllers, hard disk video recorders, and audio mixers; works with marketing team to edit "B-roll footage for inclusion in live productions; provides limited troubleshooting of video and audio quality, researches trends and makes recommendations to department for software and equipment pur- chases.          Post-Production          Plans and performs video post-production tasks which includes reviewing footage, making editorial deci- sions based on marketing guidance, video transcoding, rough cuts, audio adjustment, color correction, and final editing using Final Cut Pro (or other industry standard software); utilizes computer graphics and special effects for video post-production in accordance with the overall production concepts; compresses video projects for output; captures recorded video using software and encode media as appropriate; makes video products available in a variety of formats including DVDs or streaming media files; publishes, organizes, and optimizes media on third party websites such as YouTube, Facebook Twitter, and other social media platforms; coordinates internal and external duplication services as required. A typical qualifying background would include a bachelor's degree in telecommunication or video production.          Experience          Progressively responsible experience in a professional video editing/producing environment demonstrating competence in all areas of video production.
